text: DEFINITION 2.2 A context-free grammar is a 4-tuple (V. Y, R, S), where 1. V is a finite set called the vøriables, 2. Y is a finite set, disjoint from V, called the terminals, 3. Ris a finite set of rules, with each rule being a variable and a string of variables and terminals, and 4. S € V is the start variable.
